So I think we have a really interesting video for today. I see a lot of developments on the charts that get me a little excited and I don't get excited too often, but there's a lot of encouraging type of moves across the entire space, whether it's Bitcoin, altcoins, market caps. We're seeing a lot of really strong evidence that we could have and most likely have the four-year cycle low in December behind us. Now, let's get stuck into it. This is the weekly full cycles report where we focus mostly on Bitcoin and the cycles. Of course, the Bitcoin cycle is the main driver of the entire space with a market cap dominance of over 50% still. It stands to reason that the longest serving cryptocurrency and the most secure or the most mostly widely followed, sorry, mostly held and followed coin is the dominant asset class for this entire space. So understanding what Bitcoin is doing helps us across the entire spectrum of trading in the crypto space. So now we're on day 53 of a 60-day cycle. We are getting close to the next cycle low. The last cycle ended on day 53 where we are right now. The cycle before that ended on day 65. You see a few other ones 51, 56, 84. That one was the most stretched cycle that we've had. Point being is that we are now really close to the point where we should be seeing a cycle low. But here is the rub. Here is the problem or here is where it is not so clear. We are on day 53 where we should be in a really, we should easily be into the declining portion of the cycle by this point. Look at any one of these cycles. Look at the last one here, declining last 20 days, declining last 30 days. Not so much on this one here, but not, certainly not going higher. Declining, declining, declining. Every cycle by day 53 is declining. But this one is actually going up. It's rallying. I wouldn't call it rallying, but it's moving higher. It's every dip is being bought and it's moving higher. It's above the 10-day moving average. Its trend is higher. And this is confusing. Well, it's not confusing in the sense that we don't know what's going on. It's just confusing to the person that looks at cycles from a low, high, low, high, standpoint. We're expecting this to drop down and it's not doing that. So there's a couple of things that are going on here. One is that it's just going to be an extended cycle, meaning it's going to form a low around day 65, day 70, maybe even day 75, for example. So there's still time for it to kind of get up and come down as this chart here indicates.
